Drink water, fruit juice, or sports drinks to rehydrate and replace electrolytes lost due to alcohol's diuretic effects.
Avoid caffeinated beverages as they can worsen dehydration.
Eat bland foods like toast, crackers, or rice to boost blood sugar and settle the stomach. Bouillon soup can replenish sodium and potassium.
Avoid heavy, greasy foods which can exacerbate nausea.
Over-the-counter pain relievers such as ibuprofen or aspirin alleviate headaches and muscle aches.
Avoid Tylenol (acetaminophen) with alcohol due to the risk of liver damage.
Extra sleep can help alleviate symptoms faster by allowing the body time to recover from the effects of alcohol.
Ensure a quiet, dark environment to improve sleep quality.
Some suggest natural remedies like Korean pear juice, ginger, B vitamins, and zinc supplements.
Always consult with healthcare professionals before trying new remedies.
